title: ICE: no errors encountered even though `delay_span_bug` issued

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
<!--
Thank you for finding an Internal Compiler Error! 🧊  If possible, try to provide
a minimal verifiable example. You can read "Rust Bug Minimization Patterns" for
how to create smaller examples.
http://blog.pnkfx.org/blog/2019/11/18/rust-bug-minimization-patterns/
-->

### Code

```Rust
.route(
            "/panoramas/upload",
            put(upload_panorama_image)
                .route_layer(DefaultBodyLimit::disable())
                .route_layer(RequestBodyLimitLayer::new(10_485_760)),
        )
```

This code uses `axum`, `tower_http` ~~the features `error_in_core` and `try_trait_v2`~~.

~~I haven't been able to create a minimal verifiable example. I will continue trying and edit this issue.~~

```rust
use axum::{routing::put, Json, Router};
use tower_http::limit::RequestBodyLimitLayer;

async fn hello() -> Json<()> {
    Json(())
}

pub(crate) fn setup() -> Router<()> {
    Router::new()
        .route(
            "/",
            put(hello).layer(RequestBodyLimitLayer::new(10_485_760)),
        )
        .route(
            "/panoramas/upload",
            put(hello).route_layer(RequestBodyLimitLayer::new(10_485_760)),
        )
}

fn main() {}
```

I _think_ this is the minimal verifiable example.

### Meta
<!--
If you're using the stable version of the compiler, you should also check if the
bug also exists in the beta or nightly versions.
-->

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.71.0-nightly (2f2c438dc 2023-05-08)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 2f2c438dce75d8cc532c3baa849eeddc0901802c
commit-date: 2023-05-08
host: aarch64-apple-darwin
release: 1.71.0-nightly
LLVM version: 16.0.2
```

Fails on `2023-05-10`, `2023-05-01`, `2023-04-01` and stable.

### Error output

https://gist.github.com/indietyp/d291b4398294d37fbaf8b9e8cbf36cf2
